data.title: Hewitt's makes winning Perth exit
data.meta_description: Retiring veteran has farewelled Perth with one last victory, in the mixed doubles against Ukraine.
data.text:
Retiring veteran Lleyton Hewitt has farewelled Perth with one last win after Australia Gold took out the dead mixed doubles rubber at the Hopman Cup this afternoon.

Ukraine had already confirmed their place in Saturday’s final with wins in both the women’s and men’s singles, but the Australian pairing of Hewitt and Jarmila Wolfe had one more effort left in them.

The doubles rubber had to be decided in a match tie-breaker, with Australia Gold eventually emerging victorious 3-6 7-5 10-5 to make it a 2-1 loss in the tie.

Seven’s Summer of Tennis is in full swing and with unparalleled coverage you don’t ever have to miss a point. Stream it live on 7tennis.com.au or from our new 7Tennis apps. Download for iOS here and android here.

Earlier, world No.19 Elina Svitolina continued her unbeaten run in the women’s singles with a comfortable 6-3 6-3 win over Wolfe to put Ukraine 1-0 up.

Alexandr Dolgopolov then sealed the tie win with a 4-6 6-3 6-4 win over Hewitt, who fought to the very end in his final singles match in Perth.

It is just the second time Ukraine has made the final in the event’s history as they try to lift the trophy for the first time in 28 years.

Hewitt, 34, said he was happy with his performance against Dolgopolov.

He said he had focused on his preparations for his last Australian Open later this month when he realised a place in the Hopman Cup final was unlikely.

“It was another good hit out today,” Hewitt said. “I felt in patches I played some really good tennis today. I’d never played Alexandr before, he’s a tough guy to really get a read on.

“He plays so many funky shots out there and there was probably only one or two points in it in the end.

“If I was able to break halfway through that third set, and then I had break points to try and get back to 5-5 and then I was up an early set and a break as well so all in all it was a really good hit out.”
